column4: Whenever I access the Gnome print settings manager, I get a segfault.
I really don't want to reinstall 11.10, so is there a quick and easy fix for this? I already deleted my .cups file in ~.
.cups folder*
Not the folder from /etc, easily confuseable and would be cause for alarm...
at what point does the print manager segfault?
at what point does the print settings manager segfault?
On load.
have you ever checked your memory?
wouldn't hurt
if trying to install an HP eprinter started this, there might be something horriblly wrong in the configuration file
I can delete that and have it respawn fresh right?
maybe it will regerate. but to be safe, just rename the file
I'm looking. the file name might take a while
if you're using gnome, you should find the print settings in gnome-print-manager.schemas
Is it a setting I can modify in either gconf or dconf?
probably in gconf. but it's also (supposed to be) a file you can edit
It doesn't seem to0 be a memory issue as I gave it a full battery of RAM testing.
the config must have gotten horrbly misconfigured when you tried to install that printer
are you still completely unable to launch the gnome printer settings?
if you can start the config from hp-setup, it's probably worth the try
you could always rebuild your custom x session settings from a blank slate, I guess
so, problem solved itself?
that's not good, might indicate a subtle memory problem
